alert.note: Alert for Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 05 at 1:05PM PST by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues with already saturated soils. * WHERE...Portions of central California and northern California, including the following counties, in central California, Monterey and San Benito. In northern California, Santa Clara and Santa Cruz. * WHEN...Until 315 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 100 PM PST, Doppler radar indicated moderate rain continues to move over the region. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.05 to 0.2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Salinas, Watsonville, Gilroy, Hollister, Seaside, Monterey, Marina, Corralitos, Gonzales, Carmel-By-The-Sea, Carmel Valley Village, Prunedale, Boronda, Spreckels, Ridgemark, Chualar, Castroville, Moss Landing, Interlaken and Freedom. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Monterey; San Benito; Santa Clara; Santa Cruz
